title: Third victim reportedly dies after Pawtucket ice rink shooting
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Gerald Dorgan, 75, has died after being critically injured in the February 16 shooting at Dennis M. Lynch Arena.
The shooting at a high school hockey game also claimed the lives of Rhonda Dorgan and her son Aidan Dorgan.
Shooter Robert Dorgan was subdued but then committed suicide; the incident was called a 'targeted family dispute.'

title: Cat saved after days stuck in a tree following the blizzard that blanketed Rhode Island
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Matt Lyons climbed 40-50 feet to rescue Pixie the cat, marooned by a blizzard in Rhode Island.
Pixie spent nearly two days in a tree during the storm; Lyons sheltered her in his sweatshirt while climbing down.
Local authorities were unable to assist, prompting neighbors to seek help via the Nextdoor app.

title: 4 questions facing Bruins as they return from Olympic break
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Bruins have 25 games left in the 2025-26 season and are in a playoff spot, starting with Columbus.
Boston's penalty kill ranks 28th in the NHL, struggling at 64.8% since 2026, while penalty minutes are a concern.
James Hagens, the 2025 draft pick, could join the Bruins soon, adding to their young talent for the future.

title: Fire erupts at MCI-Norfolk prison, no major injuries reported
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Fire at MCI-Norfolk prison started in a housing unit and was extinguished quickly by Norfolk Fire Department.
Three incarcerated individuals were treated for smoke inhalation; one staff member hospitalized as a precaution.
Officials are assessing fire damage and investigating the cause, with potential housing impacts under review.

title: Stephen A. Smith endorses Jaylen Brown as an MVP candidate
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stephen A. Smith endorses Jaylen Brown for NBA MVP, highlighting his performance amid Jayson Tatum's absence.
Boston Celtics sit in second place in the Eastern Conference with a 38-19 record, exceeding preseason expectations.
Brown averages 29.2 points, 7.0 rebounds, and 4.9 assists per game, leading Boston despite a restructured team.

title: Harvard professor on leave as college investigates ties to Jeffrey Epstein
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Harvard professor Martin Nowak placed on leave amid new investigation into ties with Jeffrey Epstein.
Epstein donated $6.5 million to Harvard's Program for Evolutionary Dynamics, which Nowak directed.
Former Harvard president Larry Summers also resigned following DOJ document releases revealing Epstein connections.

title: Malden educator, basketball coach charged with rape in incident involving high school student, officials say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Scott Marino, a Malden educator and basketball coach, was arrested and charged with rape and other offenses.
Marino, placed on leave, is accused of an incident involving a Malden High School student outside working hours.
Charges include two counts of rape and indecent assault; the Middlesex District Attorney is handling the case.

title: Red Sox’ Wilyer Abreu explains viral broken-bat check swing
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Wilyer Abreu's bat broke on a check swing during a spring training game against the Pittsburgh Pirates.
Abreu theorized the bat might have been compromised from a previous at-bat despite no visible damage.
In 2025, Abreu hit 22 home runs and won a Golden Glove despite playing only 115 games due to injury.

title: All Mass. customers should have power fully restored by end of Friday night, Eversource says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Eversource and National Grid aim to fully restore power in Eastern Massachusetts by midnight Friday after a major blizzard.
As of Wednesday, 121,000 customers on Cape Cod and Martha's Vineyard, and 40,000 in Plymouth and New Bedford remain without power.
Eversource has enlisted crews from Canada, New Hampshire, and Ohio, working 18-hour shifts to address the power outage.

title: Team USA captain Hilary Knight reacts to Trump’s ‘distasteful’ joke about U.S. women’s hockey team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hilary Knight criticized Donald Trump's joke about the U.S. women's hockey team, calling it 'distasteful' on ESPN's SportsCenter.
Both U.S. men's and women's hockey teams won gold at the 2026 Winter Olympics, defeating Canada 2-1 in overtime.
The U.S. women's hockey team declined Trump's State of the Union invitation due to prior commitments post-Olympics.
